alert.note: Alert for Jackson; Menifee; Morgan (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 18 at 4:18PM EDT until July 18 at 9:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 445 PM EDT FOR POWELL...WEST CENTRAL MORGAN...NORTHERN OWSLEY...CENTRAL ESTILL...NORTHEASTERN JACKSON...SOUTHERN MENIFEE...NORTHWESTERN BREATHITT...LEE AND WOLFE COUNTIES... At 416 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Vaughns Mill to Furnace to Whynot to Vincent, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Rogers Chapel around 420 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of these severe thunderstorms include Booneville, Lone, Campton, Baptist and Fivemile. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
